name: Magikarp

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Magikarp.

flavorText: In the distant past, it was stronger than its horribly weak descendants that exist today.

strengths: Evolves into the extremely powerful Gyarados
Flail can deal significant damage when Magikarp is nearly knocked out
Both attacks cost only 1 energy, enabling immediate response
Low retreat cost (1) makes it easy to switch to safety
At 2 damage counters (20 HP damage), Flail does 20 damage for 1 energy
Uncommon rarity makes it accessible for deck building
Water typing fits into Rain Dance strategies
weaknesses: 30 HP is the lowest in the entire Base Set
Lightning weakness makes it even more vulnerable
Tackle only does 10 damage, which is largely ineffective
Cannot evolve on first turn or turn played
Flail requires Magikarp to be damaged to be effective
Extremely vulnerable to being knocked out before evolving
synergies: Gyarados - The evolution that justifies playing Magikarp
Blastoise - Rain Dance can help set up Gyarados quickly
Pokémon Breeder - Can accelerate evolution to Gyarados
Defender - Helps Magikarp survive one more hit
Switch - Provides escape option when Magikarp is in danger
Bill - Draws cards to find Gyarados faster
Scoop Up - Saves Magikarp from being knocked out
counters: Literally any attacker - 30 HP means almost everything can OHKO
Electabuzz - Lightning weakness + Thunderpunch = instant KO
Zapdos - Thunder will always OHKO Magikarp
Hitmonchan - Special Punch for 1 Fighting energy OHKOs
Gust of Wind - Forces Magikarp active for easy prize
Any 30+ damage attack - Will knock out Magikarp in one hit

description: Magikarp is the weakest Basic Pokémon in the Base Set, featuring a mere 30 HP and minimal offensive capability. However, this famously feeble Fish Pokémon evolves into the fearsome Gyarados, one of the most powerful cards in the set. Magikarp's Flail attack offers an interesting damage-scaling mechanic that increases as it takes damage, creating a risk-reward dynamic where a nearly-defeated Magikarp can potentially deal significant damage before being knocked out or evolved.
competitiveHistory: Magikarp saw play exclusively as a necessary component for accessing Gyarados in the Base Set era. No competitive player valued Magikarp for its own capabilities - it was purely evolution material. The 30 HP made it a liability, and experienced opponents would target Magikarp with Gust of Wind for easy prizes. Despite this, Gyarados was powerful enough that some players were willing to deal with Magikarp's extreme weakness. The card became somewhat notorious as the ultimate 'worthless until evolved' Pokémon, though it retained cult popularity due to its video game legacy.

rulings.ruling: Flail does 0 damage if Magikarp has no damage counters (10 × 0 = 0).
Flail does 20 damage (10 × 2 damage counters = 20 damage).
Very few. Most basic attacks do 30+ damage, which will OHKO Magikarp. Only attacks doing 20 or less damage will fail to knock it out in one hit.
Magikarp would be Knocked Out, as it only has 30 HP. Three damage counters represent 30 damage, which equals Magikarp's total HP.
Yes. As long as you have the required energy (1 Colorless for Tackle, 1 Water for Flail), you can choose which attack to use.
